average.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the average amount is the amount you get when you add together several quantities and divide this by the total number of quantities
average.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The age of the candidates ranged from 29 to 49 with an average age of 37.
The average cost of making a movie has risen by 15%.
Last winter was colder than average.
The cars were being sold at an average price of $11,000.
average.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an average amount or quantity is not unusually big or small
average.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: They have an average-size front garden and a large rear garden.
He was in his late twenties and of average height.
average.translation[0].definitions[2].de: having qualities that are typical of most people or things
average.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
average.translation[0].definitions[3].de: neither very good nor very bad
average.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the amount calculated by adding together several quantities, and then dividing this amount by the total number of quantities
average.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The December figures brought the annual average for 2001 up to 10.6 per cent.
Each person raised an average of £60 to plant an acre of trees.
average.translation[1].definitions[1].de: the usual level or amount for most people or things
average.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Streets in the town centre are wider than the average.
The murder rate in the city has risen to four times the national average.
The school’s eighth-graders are above average in science.
average.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to usually do something or usually happen a particular number of times, or to usually be a particular size or amount
average.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The water in the lake is not particularly deep, averaging about 12 metres.
The airport averages about a thousand flights a month.
Inflation averaged just under 2.8% per year.
average.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to calculate the average of figures
average.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The rate of growth was averaged over a period of three years.
average.translation[3].definitions[0].de: the average amount is the amount you get when you add together several amounts and divide this by the number of amounts you have added together
average.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Oil companies are basing their budgets on an average price of $20.40 a barrel.
The electronics industry has increased output by an average rate of 14% a year.
Average earnings in the state are about $2500 a month.
average.translation[3].definitions[1].de: having qualities that are typical of most of the people or things in a group
average.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: The average employee in Chicago must work 18 minutes to buy a hamburger.
Coffee production in an average year here totals 450,000 tonnes.
average.translation[4].definitions[0].de: the amount calculated by adding together several amounts, and then dividing this amount by the total number of amounts added together
average.translation[4].definitions[0].ex: Sales in the various markets improved by an average of 40% last year.
average.translation[4].definitions[1].de: based on a calculation of how many times something happens, how much money someone usually gets, how often people usually do something etc
average.translation[4].definitions[1].ex: On average, people in their 50s require 45% more drug prescriptions than people in their 30s.
Visitors to Legoland on average spend $26 each.
average.translation[4].definitions[2].de: the usual level or amount for most people or things in a group
average.translation[4].definitions[2].ex: Employee pay and benefits are above average here.
Stockmarket volume was below average at 12.1 million shares traded.
Tea productivity in Assam is over 2,000 kg a hectare, compared with a national average in India of 1,790 kg a hectare.
average.translation[4].definitions[3].de: a list of shares on a stock market, showing the general level of shares at a particular moment
average.translation[4].definitions[3].ex: The industrial average (=shares in industrial companies on a particular stockmarket) surged 535.17 points, or 20.3%.
average.translation[4].definitions[4].de: a loss relating to damage to a ship or the CARGO (=goods it is carrying)
average.translation[5].definitions[0].de: if something averages a particular amount or rate, that is its average amount or rate
average.translation[5].definitions[0].ex: In Europe, budget deficits average 5% of GDP.
The store is averaging sales of $300,000 on an annual basis.
average.translation[5].definitions[1].de: to calculate the average of a number of amounts
average.translation[5].definitions[1].ex: The new system works by averaging the payments made to local authorities.
